intro: Curmeria, commonly known as the Indian breadfruit or wild breadfruit, is a tropical plant belonging to the Moraceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces a fruit that is typically green when unripe and turns yellow or brown when mature. The fruit is edible when cooked and has a texture similar to bread, hence its common name. It is often used in traditional cuisines and has various medicinal uses in folk remedies.
